publicationStmt.idno: Greek Manuscripts at the Wellcome Library in London: A Descriptive Catalogue

msContents.summary: Greek medical texts consisting of two volumes bound separately but foliated continuously. The second volume comprises two distinct parts. Volume 1 and the first half of volume 2 are the work of the same scribe and were originally bound together.

supportDesc.support: Paper Fly leaves ii-iii in volume 1 and ff.405-406: unclear watermark. Fly leaves iv-v in volume 1 and ff.404: watermark very similar to Piccard 150772, 150409, 150636 (three hills) attested in 1461-1477. Fly leaves ii-iii in volume 1 and ff.405-406: Chain distance 31mm. Fly leaves iv-v in volume 1 and ff.404: Chain distance 25mm.

additions.p: Text on the flyleaves: IVv: two recipes . Vr: . Vr: recipe . Vv
Marks of ownership: f.363r: . The following three lines of text are completely blotted out. f.404r: . flyleaf Vr: . flyleaf IIr: Ex Bibliotheca Askeviana / P. ii. Art 540 / J. Sims.

binding.p: Corio russico. Pastdowns and outermost flyleaves: machine-made paper

history.provenance: Held at the Stavronikita Monastery, Mount Athos
Owned by Anthony Askew (1722-1774) and sold at his auction sale, G. Leigh and J. Sotheby, London, 15 March 1785, lot 540 to James Sims (1741-1820).
Purchased by the London Medical Society in 1802.
history.acquisition: Purchased by the Wellcome Library in 1984.

msContents.summary: Three works by John Zacharias Aktouarios comprising the entirety of volume 1 and the first part of volume 2.

msItem.author: John Zacharias Aktouarios
msItem.title: On the activities and illnesses of the psychic pneuma and the corresponding mode of living

msItem.author: John Zacharias Aktouarios
msItem.title: On Urines
msItem.filiation: Another version of this work is in MS.MSL.124

msItem.author: John Zacharias Aktouarios
msItem.title: Medical Epitome, books 1, 2 and 3 and first part of books 6, 4 and 5
msItem.filiation: Another version of this work is in MS.MSL.112
msItem.note: Books 3-6 have no Greek edition yet and have only been published in Latin translation. The manuscript belongs to a family where the first part of Book 6 forms the second part of Book 3 and the second part of Book 6 comes after Book 5. The second part of Book 6 is missing from this manuscript.

supportDesc.support: Folded in 4. Similar to Piccard 122469 (scissors), attested in 1455. Chain distance 33mm.

collation.signatures: (ff.1-43) non-scribal, Greek numerals (f.9r) through (f.41r). (ff.44-211) scribal, Greek numerals (excepts for on f.51v) (f.51v) through (f.204r). (f.212-332) possibly scribal, Greek numerals (f.21r) through (f.326r)

layoutDesc.layout: ff.1-43 25 written lines. c.173 107 Unclear ruling.

handDesc.handNote: Attributed by Mondrain to Demetrios Angelos.

decoDesc.decoNote: f.44r: diagram (possibly scribal) of the urine vial dividied into eleven areas, corresponding to John Aktouarios' 'On Urines' [Book I, chapter 13]: .
f.63r: X-shaped diagram (possibly scribal)showing the four qualities and labelled: .
f.146r: X-shaped diagram (possibly scribal)showing the four qualities and labelled: .
f.147v: Four triangular diagrams (possibly scribal) showing the four qualities and labelled: .

additions.p: Text added by later hands: (44r) partly erased recipe including ; (143v) ; (144r-v)

origin.origDate: shortly before 1463 AD (from the note on f.332v)

msContents.summary: Compilation of short texts and extracts regarding sweats, pulse, excrements, remedies, drugs and disease.

msItem.author: Theophilus Protospatharius
msItem.title: On the differences among the fevers

msItem.author: Anonymous
msItem.title: On Pulse
msItem.note: Text in the form of questions and answers. For example 340v .

Some parts of the text on the first folia represent a synopsis of Galen's On the pulse for beginners, Gottlob. From f.338r the text is similar to the annonymous synopsis on pulses published by Daremberg and Ruelle (338r.15-341r.112), including {~id, 219.4-231.13}.

msItem.author: Galen
msItem.title: On the pulse for beginners, excerpt

msItem.author: Anonymous
msItem.title: Collection of recipes for composite drugs.

supportDesc.support: Folded in 4. Similar to Piccard 122600 (ANVIL), attested in 1444. Chain distance 38mm.

collation.signatures: (non-scribal) Greek numerals (except for on f.399v) (f.340r) through (f.388r).

handDesc.handNote: Similar to those of (according to Georgi Parpulov) Constantine Triboles (RGK II 318) and (according to Rudolph Stefec) Mark (RGK III 437).

decoDesc.decoNote: f.338v: non-scribal partial X-shaped diagram of pulses.

additions.p: Scribal annotations: (ff.334r, 334v, 335r, 337r, 339v, 348r, 348v, 351v, 354v, 355r, 356r, 357v, 357r, 357v, 358r, 359r, 363v, 365v, 367r, 368v, 370r, 373v, 377v, 378r, 380v, 381r, 384v, 385v, 387r, 392v, 396r, 396v, 397v, 401v) additions or corrections to the main text, variant readings, indications of contents e.g. (f.337r)

Non-scribal annotations: (f.379v) ; (f.333r) title added: ; (f.361v) title added ; (f.380r) Rhaz[eus] lib[er] XIX. cap[itulus] XX.

Recipes added by later hands: (f.333v) including ; (f.354r) ; (f.363r) including ; (f.363r) erased text; (f.364r) including ; (f.366v) including , end lost.
